result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnathan T Evans was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Johnathan T Evans is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Johnathan T Evans was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Successfully complete Anger Management, and continue programming. Attend and complete parenting classes. Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment. Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.

Maintain absolute sobriety. No drugs. No alcohol. No contact with victim, Chiqweeta C.  Agent, then can change to non-violent contact after AM is finished.  Parties may not reside together. Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.

Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, DNA surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections, during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT. Cash bail to apply to both cases    2013CF5726 and 2014CF1306. Restitution is set at zero.
No firearms; weapons. 48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Johnathan T Evans

Bail Notice/Affidavit mailed to surety on 09/25/14. AR

Defendant Johnathan T Evans in court with attorney Eugene J. Dietzler.  Defendant Johnathan T Evans in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
Defendant sentenced to serve 8 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to case 2013CF5726), in the House of Correction with credit for 153 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 YEAR.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 20 DAYS
   in the House of Correction.  Stayed pending review.
* Successfully complete Anger Management, 
   and continue programming.
* Attend and complete parenting classes.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Chiqweeta C.
   Agent, then can change to non-violent contact 
   after AM is finished.  Parties may not reside together.    
* Defendant may have contact with the victim
   through a third party to arrange time with children.
* Obtain and maintain employment.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, DNA surcharge, and supervision fees as 
   determined by the Department of Corrections, 
   during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
    --- cash bail to apply to both cases 
    2013CF5726 and 2014CF1306.
* Restitution is set at zero.
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
 Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.   mld

Defendant Johnathan T Evans in court with attorney Eugene J. Dietzler.  Defendant Johnathan T Evans in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Upon the Motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS #1, #3 and #4, dismissed on prosecutor's motion.  This now makes this case a misdemeanor.

 AS TO AMENDED COUNT #2: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 9-3-2014 at 1:30 pm.   mld

received and filed.
*
COUNT 2: BAIL JUMPING (MISDEMEANOR), DOMESTIC ABUSE, contrray to Wisconsin State Statute(s) 946.49(1)(a) and 968.075(1)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  Drug testing, breathalyzer tests, absoluste sobriety.  Absolutely no release from home (24 hour curfew).  mld

Attorney Eugene J. Dietzler in court, defendant Johnathan T Evans not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Defense Motion to Modify Bail (case 2014CF1306), is heard and granted by the Court.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on  8-11-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld
with all previously ordered conditions of bail continued.   mld
Defense Motion to Modify Bail is heard and granted by the Court.   mld

Defendant Johnathan T Evans in court with attorney Eugene J Dietzler.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty as to all (4) four counts. Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of discovery packet from the State.  Offer will be forthcoming to defense counsel, per the State.  Upon the motion of the State, Court ordered the following cases consolidated for the purposes of trial: Case 2013CF5726 and 2014CF1306.  Defense is not opposed to the  joinder of cases.  DEMAND for Speedy Trial entered by defense counsel.  Court ordered cases 2013CF5726 and 2014CF1306 are adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 8-11-2014 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of are continued until further order of the Court.  

As to case 2013CF5726, Court vacates the Jury Trial date of 6-18-2014 at 830 am, Branch 4.   mld

Attorney Eugene J Dietzler in court, defendant Johnathan T Evans not in court, in custody.  Ryan Sanson for Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
BRANCH 40 FOR BRANCH 4.
  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Case remains set for preliminary hearing on 5/19/14 in Branch 4.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CHIQWEETA C. (1/2/84) AND TRINIDY J. (9/25/86)

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Johnathan T Evans in court with attorney Enku E Lin.  Defendant Johnathan T Evans in custody.  Steven H Glamm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FLANAGAN, Branch 4.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
